com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.core

Class AfterModification

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.core.AfterModification

  • public class AfterModification
extends Object
    This class is a message from the modifier to the stream processor, or technically spoken, this class represents the return value of Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean). This return value defines how the stream processor, i. e. either a ModifyingReader or a ModifyingWriter, shall behave before calling Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) again.

    Therefore, this class defines

    • how many modifiable characters the stream processor shall add to the character buffer,
    • how many unmodifiable characters the stream processor shall keep in the character buffer,
    • whether modifiable characters shall be shall be made unmodifiable, and if so, how many modifiable characters shall be made unmodifiable.

    If you want to implement your own modifier, then you should distinct three different types of AfterModification messages - depending on how many characters shall be skipped and how many characters are left in the buffer and how many characters are left in the entire stream:

    • SKIP: Skip at least one modifiable character in the buffer, or do not skip any character if there are no modifiable characters are left in the buffer but the end of stream is not hit yet. A synonym for SKIP could be CONTINUE.
    • MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY: Do not skip any character. This type is useful only if the end of stream is not hit yet and the modifier needs more input to do its job.
    • STOP: Do not skip any character. This requires that the end of stream is hit and no modifiable characters are left in the buffer.
    • (FETCH_MORE_INPUT: This is a synonym for SKIP if some characters can be skipped. Otherwise it is a MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY.)
    Since:
    03.06.2011
    Author:
    rwoo

      • getNewMinimumLengthOfLookBehind

        public int getNewMinimumLengthOfLookBehind()
        Returns:
        Returns the newMinimumLengthOfLookBehind.

        The value must be a positive number or zero.

      • getNewNumberOfChars

        public int getNewNumberOfChars()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of unmodifiable characters (look-behind) and modifiable characters in the buffer that shall be passed to Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) the next time this method is called.

        Unless the end of the stream is hit, ModifyingReader and ModifyingWriter do not provide fewer characters to the modifier than requested by the value returned here.

        The value must be a positive number greater than zero.

      • isModifyAgainImmediately

        public boolean isModifyAgainImmediately()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the modifier shall be called again immediately.

        This is usually true either if we want to edit the insertion itself or if the modifier has to read more characters to decide again about an appropriate modification. The latter one is particularly useful for modifiers that use (greedy) regular expressions.

        See also getNumberOfCharactersToSkip().

      • getNumberOfCharactersToSkip

        public int getNumberOfCharactersToSkip()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of characters to skip if the modification shall no be tried again, i.e. if isModifyAgainImmediately() is false. In this case this number must be at least one unless the end of the stream is hit.

        After the modifiable characters are investigated by the modifier and some characters might be deleted or inserted, you have to specify the number of characters that are no longer considered modifiable. If the end of the stream is not hit and isModifyAgainImmediately() returns false, then this method must return at least 1 -- so that the processing of the characters of the stream makes any progress.

        In all cases the value of this property must be a non-negative number.

        This property will be ignored by ModifyingReader and ModifyingWriter if isModifyAgainImmediately() returns true.

      • getMessageType

        public String getMessageType()
        Returns:
        Returns an informal description of the type of the message, i.e. either SKIP or MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY or STOP.

        public String toString()
